Title:
Asproinocybaceae fam. nov. (Agaricales, Agaricomycetes) for
accommodating the genera Asproinocybe and Tricholosporum, and
description of Asproinocybe sinensis and Tricholosporum guangxiense sp.
nov.
Keywords:
new taxon; phylogeny; karst areas; Guangxi;
Tricholomataceae
Abstract:
Asproinocybe sinensis and Tricholosporum guangxiense, is
described as new species from subtropical karst areas of China. The main
distinguishing characteristics of Asproinocybe sinensis are the central
of pileus dark brown; with larger basidia (33 × 10 µm); cheilocystidia
(30-40 × 8-10 µm) and pleurocystidia (38 × 9 µm) present and the apex
unbranched; hyphae of pileipellis with finely incrustation.
Tricholosporum guangxiense characterized by the basidiomata medium in
sized, pileus no color-spots, central with obvious yellowish-brownish
color at mature; cheilocystidia and pleurocystidia unfurcate and
sometimes with purplish pigment; spores cyanophilous, not exceeding 7
µm, 5.4 × 4.7 µm. The phylogenetic analyses based on ITS+LSU and six
genes (ITS, nrLSU, RPB1, RPB2, nrSSU, TEF1-α) using Bayesian (BA) and
Maximum Likelihood (ML) methods showed that the two new taxons can be
distinguished from phenotypically similar and phylogenetically related
species and form an independent family clade (BPP=0.98, BS=72).
Asproinocybaceae fam. nov., a new family is established here for
accommodating the Asproinocybe/Tricholosporum clade.
